title: Apparent Mistake in Language Spec
body:
by **poojac20**: 
Go Version: Not Applicable. 

In the language spec at http://golang.org/ref/spec#Semicolons , under point 2, it is
written that 

<quote>
To allow complex statements to occupy a single line, a semicolon may be omitted before a
closing ")" or "}".
</quote>

I think it should be 

To allow complex statements to occupy *multiple lines*, a semicolon may be omitted
before a closing ")" or "}".

***

I searched for a place to report such an error (like a Wiki setting for the
documentation pages) and did not find it. Hence the bug tracker.  
I know that this may not be the best place to report such issues. I had found two more
minor corrections in the documentation (from-form typos) but I've forgotten where. If
you let me know the right place to report, I will use it. 

If the spec is right and I am wrong, please correct my understanding.

Thank you.
